treatment.reference: Methanopyrus kandleri, gen. and sp. nov. represents a novel group of hyperthermophilic methanogens, growing at 110 ° C Arch Microbiol 156:239-247
treatment.description: Cells are gram-positive rods, about 0.5 µm in diameter and 2 to 14 µm (majority: 8 to 10 µm) long, occurring singly and in chains up to 70 (majority: up to 10) cells. Motile by polar tufts of flagella. String-like aggregates formed under shaking. Greenish colonies about 1 mm in diameter formed on Gelrite plates. Cell division by septa formation. Bilayered cell envelope. S-layer about 20 nm wide, SDS-soluble; inner layer about 20 nm wide, SDS-resistant, most likely a sacculus consisting of pseudomurein. Cell surface covered with slime. Pseudomurein composed of L-glutamic acid, L-alanine, L-lysine, L-ornithine, N-acetylgalactosamine and talosaminuronic acid. No N-acetylglucosamine. Core lipid exclusively 2,3-di-Ophytanyl- glycerol. Cyclic 2,3-diphosphoglycerate present in high concentrations (up to 1.1 M). DNA-dependent RNA polymerase of the AB'B"C subunit pattern. Molecular weights of the subunits: A = 107,000; B'= 76,000; B"= 62,500; and C = 59,000. Chemolithoautotrophic. Methane formed. H2 and CO2 serve as energy- and carbon sources. Yeast extract and bacterial cell homogenates slightly stimulate growth. No growth on formate, acetate, methanol, methylamine, propanol, L(+)-lactate and glycerol. S° reduced, causing cell lysis. Growth between 84°C and 110°C (opt.: 98°C; 50 min doubling time), 0.2 and 4% NaCl (opt.: 2%), and pH 5.5 and 7 (opt.: 6.5). No growth at 80°C. DNA base composition 60 mol% GC. Type strain: Methanopyrus kandleri, AV19, DSM 6324, Braunschweig, FRG (isolated from the Guaymas hot vents).
